result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lee A Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lee A Brown was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Fine of $300.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and  DNA surcharges, due to low income,  to be paid  $100.00 forthwith and balance by 2-23-16 or serve 15 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee A Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.  15 days HOC,  consecutive.  Due & owing.

Defendant Lee A Brown in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

As to Count ONE

 Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

On motion of the STate, Court ordered Count TWO:  dismissed. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 4 days time served. 

Fine of $300.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and  dna surcharges, due to low income,  to be paid  $100.00 forthwith and balance by 2-23-16 or serve 15 consecutive days in the House of Correction. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Lee A Brown in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lee A Brown in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lee A Brown in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State requests an adjournment of the Status Conference. Court grants state request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
STate motion to withdraw exhibit is granted.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 07-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lee A Brown in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Suppression motion proceeded. Sworn in for the State: MPD officer Joel Susler. Exhibit one received. Sworn in :  MPD officer Mark Rothweiler; MPD officer Jason Dewitt.  State rests. Defense rests. Testimony closed. Cause argued. Court denied defense motion to suppress.
Defense filed notice of motion and motion to suppress evidence. lr

Defendant Lee A Brown in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 47. Any motions to be filed in court by 6-3-15. lr  Motion hearing scheduled for 07-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lee A Brown in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Lee A Brown in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
